'css/print/pdf.css' : 'css/print/paper.css'; document.getElementsByTagName( 'head' )[0].appendChild( link ); AGENDA 1. CLASSES: Introduction to Interaction Design Visualizing Information 2. DISCUSSION: Professional Development CLASSES INTRODUCTION TO INTERACTION DESIGN User Researcher Usability Analyst Information Architect Interaction Designer Visual Designer UX Designer (all of the above) Here is a link to Introductory Slides from Irene Pereyra VISUALIZING INFORMATION Documentary Exploratory Narrative Artistic These types of visualizations are captured in many examples in Hilla Katki's Introductory Slides For Your Reference Link to this presentation: andypbrowne.

How We Speak var link = document.createElement( 'link' ); link.rel = 'stylesheet'; link.type = 'text/css'; link.href = window.location.search.match( /print-pdf/gi ) ? 'css/print/pdf.css' : 'css/print/paper.css'; document.getElementsByTagName( 'head' )[0].appendChild( link ); How We Speak Part 1: The Significance of Amplitude Typeface How We Speak, Speaker Notes. Prepared by Andrew Browne, May 2012. Typography is the style and appearance of printed matter. A typeface is a family of fonts (like Helvetica or Futura), and a font is a particular weight of a typeface (like light, regular, medium, condensed or bold).

Mind the Gap var link = document.createElement( 'link' ); link.rel = 'stylesheet'; link.type = 'text/css'; link.href = window.location.search.match( /print-pdf/gi ) ? 'css/print/pdf.css' : 'css/print/paper.css'; document.getElementsByTagName( 'head' )[0].appendChild( link ); Mind the Gap Mind what gap? The gap is the learning curve between graphic and web design. This lecture and workshop seeks to provide some tools, exercises, and approaches to mind the gap.
